title: Black tabs
content: I am asking a question I have seen asked a hundred times but I've never seen answered. I will start with firefox is NOT in full screen. A number of updates back all tabs but the one currently being viewed has become blacked out. All that is visible is a firefox symbol or if it's a search page, the google symbol. Not the page title as before. Before the update all tab details were visible at all times. How do I revert to having my tab details being displayed so I don't have to go through all tabs to find the one I want. I don't want to know another way of finding a particular page I have open, just how to bring back the tab information as it always was. I'm very close to changing browsers because of this tragic improvement firefox has implemented.
creator: box4scams

title: Unable to delete incorrect autofill entries in login fields
content: Somehow several email addresses of spammers that I was reporting ended up as Firefox autofill entries in all my login fields. Supremely annoying. I am unable to select and delete them. How can I do this? Can I do this from a private window?
creator: Xenu

title: How to prevent Firefox from automatically updating and restarting with no option to do anything else
content: The title says it all. I find it very frustrating when I'm in the middle of doing something and Firefox pops up a message saying "Restarting Firefox" or the patronising "we just have to do one thing...", then closing Firefox and restarting. How can I stop Firefox from doing this? Why can't it just give me a notification that an update is available and that I need to restart to activate it? That would be MUCH friendlier. I have read a number of other posts that contain similar issues, but none of the solutions seem to apply to my version, 99.0. There are some options in about:config and about:preferences, but I am not clear on exactly what they do and whether or not changing them would achieve what I want to do without upsetting something else. Is there an easy way? All advice gratefully received.
creator: mogplus8

title: Saving my preference for logins and passwords for websites.
content:
I have Firefox installed on two computers, a HP Envy laptop with Windows 10 Home and a new workstation with Windows 10 Pro. I also have Trend Micro Internet Security on both. I have gone through the FF settings on both computers the make sure they are set the same. The problem is that on the laptop FF will ask for and save passwords then when I log in to a forum the password is automatically filled in for me. On the workstation that is not the case. I need to open FF Settings scroll to Privacy and security settings and reset the "Ask to save logins and passwords for websites" setting. Somehow on the workstation that setting gets deselected but the laptop is does not.

I found an article that instructs to remove the Trend Micro Password manager but even though it is installed on both computers it is not activated on either and I don't use it.

So why does the workstation not save passwords with the Trend PW mgr but the laptop does?

Thanks for any clues you can give me as it is getting a bit tedious having to reset the Ask to save option every time I want to log in to a forum on the workstation.

Regards, Harold Lakoduk
creator: hlakoduk

title: OWA (Outlook Web Version) Drag and Drop Not Working with Firefox 99
content: Since the latest Firefox 99 update, when I drag and drop an attachment into an Outlook Web Access email on Firefox browser, it does not work (can do attachments through the attachment button, but this takes much more time to click, locate file, and attach). This process continues to work on my other browsers (Safari, Chrome). This is very frustrating (making me consider switching my primary browser. Any help with this would be appreciated.
creator: cmartell

title: Firefox file in MacOS Library (.sqlite) preventing TimeMachine from completing backup.
content:
I am running MacOS 12.3 (Monterey) on a MacMini M1. It has not been able to complete a successful Time Machine backup since April 1st. Prior to April 1st Time Machine backed-up fine. The error message is on the accompanying image. I called Apple Tech Support and they really did not know the causation, though we did tell Time Machine to skip the mentioned file. The back up was then successful.

I, unfortunately, do not remember the version of Firefox, other than esr and that I updated a month or two ago. I am pretty sure the version number was in the 90's. I did update to 91.6 esr tonight.

Thank you.
creator: gym4jim

title: NY Times crossword
content: I can't send the Times crossword to my printer. When I click on "Print" from the Crossword web-page it only allows me to save it as a pdf. I never had this problem until today. It used to be that clicking on "Print" would allow me either to save or send to my printer. Now there is no choice. Everything works fine if I use Microsoft Edge or my tablet (Android), but it won't work with FireFix on my desktop running Windows 10.
creator: mark_bridger
